answers_B: Car horns should not be used unnecessarily.
answers_C: Safety rules are crucial for preventing injuries, promoting fair play, and ensuring a positive experience for all participants. They help maintain discipline and protect players from harm.

Pollution is the introduction of harmful substances or materials into the environment. Noise pollution, characterized by loud, irritating, or unwanted sounds, can lead to stress, hearing loss, sleep disturbances, and reduced cognitive performance, thus negatively impacting human health and quality of life.

1. Limiting unnecessary car horn use: Reduces transient, high-decibel noise in urban areas. 2. Regulating music volume: Prevents excessive sound levels from disturbing residential areas. 3. Enacting government laws: Provides legal frameworks to control and penalize sources of excessive noise.

Chemical pollution is the release of hazardous chemical substances or materials into the environment that are harmful to living organisms. Examples include smoke from factories, exhaust from cars, and gases from burning refuse.

The text suggests educating people on the dangers of pollution and methods of disposal (though incomplete). This implies that awareness and proper waste management are key initial steps in preventing chemical pollution.
